website_summaries.verdict: A nice concept that brings birds up close when feeding, but some design issues may lead to disappointment – and squirrels.
pros: Clear, acrylic construction, removable tray, and sturdy perches make it a fun way to feed wild birds and watch them closely
Backed by a 100% satisfaction guarantee and helpful customer service
cons: Care must be taken to attach the suction cups securely to prevent it from slipping/falling
Small – won't accommodate many birds at once

customer_reviews.title: Not so squirrel resistant
customer_reviews.text: Probably my fault bc apparently squirrels can climb window screens but...
customer_reviews.author: taftag69

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bird feeder. The design makes it easy to use. It is clear so it doesn't block window light and gives you a clear view of the birds. There was a slight problem with the drawer of the first one. Customer service was very responsive. They cheerfully sent us another which was perfect. If only all companies stood behind their products as strongly as this one! The cat loves her "entertainment center"
customer_reviews.author: jlg

customer_reviews.title: Great Feeder!
customer_reviews.text: As someone who knows nothing about birds / bird watching / etc - I love this little house. I bought it about 6 or 7 months ago and put it up in the window. I'd say for the first 4 or 5 months, I never saw a single bird come visit. I read that this is normal as it takes time for the birds to trust the food source. Fast forward - I now have birds out there all the time. I enjoy watching them come and go and I am so happy I got this feeder!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: this has brought many hours of enjoyment for her
customer_reviews.text: Mother is now 85 and loves birds. this has brought many hours of enjoyment for her. She is unable to refill it...but stuck to the window she tells me to refill it every day....time spent watching beautiful song birds makes for smiles and excitement.....love this feeder
customer_reviews.author: fraiser

customer_reviews.title: A great window feeder
customer_reviews.text: A great window feeder. Our winter/spring birds found the feeders right away and have given my 92 year old mother many pleasurable moments watching them eat. Soon after putting them up we had 40 to 50 mph winds hit our coastline and the feeders did not budge. Also purchased another larger window feeder from you and are very satisfied with both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Mazie

customer_reviews.title: Awfully small
customer_reviews.text: The feeder is much smaller than I had expected. The picture was deceptive. It showed a cardinal in the feeder. There is no way a cardinal or a blue jay or a woodpecker could fit into it. The picture was obviously photo-shopped as cardinals are much larger than goldfinches. Yet in the picture they look to be similar in size. Wish I would have not bought it. For the price I would have expected a much larger feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine L.

customer_reviews.title: SEEMS LIKE A GOOD IDEA, BUT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you have screens on your window, then this thing is useless. Also, the rain gets into it, and then the food gets wet and moldy very fast. The bird seed starts to germinate and then grow inside of it, so it's a real hassle to clean. The drain holes on the bottom are completely inadequate for keeping the food dry.
customer_reviews.author: Educated Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, who is a bird enthusiast, and she loved it! I researched many feeders before deciding on this one, and I was not at all disappointed. The plastic is so clear it looks like glass, which makes viewing the birds effortless. Also, the size is perfect. It's not cumbersome on the window and it's lightweight. Very happy with this product and I recommend for anyone, even first time buyers like myself.
customer_reviews.author: rockin'rollercoaster

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with this!
customer_reviews.text: I AM LOVING THIS FEEDER! The Cardinals have found the feeder and the squirrels have tried but not been able to get to the food. I hope the video works. It's funny. Big YES for this feeder. UPDATE: Big wow that I found out that birds are not affected by hot pepper and....squirrels are. So I have been sprinkling ground red pepper on the seeds and not one squirrel is attempting to get it. Safe for birds. NEWER UPDATE: The Squirrels Love the feeder and the sunflower seeds even with the hot pepper. I am now trying SAFFLOWER seed and so far so good.....birds and not squirrels. I read that the squirrels do not like safflower seeds.
customer_reviews.author: NormaS

customer_reviews.title: Low quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was very low quality. I had it on my window for 2 days and the birds must of wiggled/ kicked out the seed tray which fell to the ground and broke. 2 days of use and broken
customer_reviews.author: R. Thomann

customer_reviews.title: Bad packing.
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions to place on window, didn't even stay attached for 5 minutes., The suction cups were so bent that they didn't hold a seal and fell to the ground and broke into a bunch of pieces. I don't recomend this.
customer_reviews.author: RepairMan

customer_reviews.title: This is a great bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bird feeder. It is ridiculously easy to set up. Birds usually take about 24 hours to "find" the new feeder. The price is very reasonable. The only "slight" is the cups to hold the feeder block viewing a bit. I would suggest they modify the feeder to use either smaller circumference cups or have the cups themselves farther out (closer to the edge) so as to allow for a larger viewing area. Obviously, my complaint did not cause me to lower the 5 star score. An expected bonus: Birds "line up" above and below the feeder to get in.
customer_reviews.author: Richard in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great for bird watching close up
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Took a few weeks for some birds to use regularly, only because they were familiar with two other feeders nearby. Positioned it on a window at the level of my cat's 'tree' in the living room. One cat does 'bird watching' daily and tries to get to the birds through the window - had to move the cat's perch just out of reach of the window. Both cats and I enjoy sitting in the living room watching the birds come and go. It' very relaxing. I really like the close up view this window bird feeder allows. It's easy to mount, refill and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Blujean

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely skeptical because I’ve had window feeders before that did not stick or broke almost immediately. This one has had no problems sticking to the window and has survive several days of torrential tropical down pouring rain. My cats and I have enjoyed several days of entertainment from birds and squirrels. The only problem I have now is that my cats fight over The window perch to see what’s going on with the feeder so I have had to buy a second feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Bari M Berger

customer_reviews.title: We bought another Acrylic feeder that worked well for many ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought another Acrylic feeder that worked well for many of our small visitors but noticed the cardinals were having difficulty landing due to the low height of the top of the feeder. Within 24 hours on installing this feeder, the cardinals are now able to make the approach and landing. Just what we had hoped for!
customer_reviews.author: THC-Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic window feeder
customer_reviews.text: This feeder was purchased to replace another window feeder that feel multiple times last year, ultimately breaking. So far I am impressed! The birds found it within a few hours, and it accommodates all sizes and types - we've had house finches, cardinals, tufted titmice, chickadees, wrens, and woodpeckers so far! The suction cups seem sturdy so far - I hope they stay that way! It was easy to install and seems easy to refill - the tray slides right out. I like that it has tiny holes to let any moisture/water drain through. The birds are loving this feeder, so I do, too!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Joyful purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: OK, I've been meaning to review this for awhile, but I can't pull myself away from watching my new little bird friends feed at my window bird feeder. I have wanted one of these for about 10 years but my husband (who is a kill joy) thought I was being juvenile. But let me tell you, this has brought me soo much joy. The birds stop by throughout the day for a snack. My next purchase will be a window bird house where I can hopefully watch eggs hatching.
customer_reviews.author: mominCO

customer_reviews.title: So pretty, but unfortunately......
customer_reviews.text: No takers yet... think the plastic is too clear, so the birds haven’t discovered it yet. But it looks promising. ===================== After 2 months. The only birds I’ve seen use this feeder are starlings, mourning dove and one or two sparrows. This experiment has failed. There’s no room for the birds to perch to eat, so they sit in the tray, which causes most of the bird seeds to fly all over and into the gaps between the gray and the window. We have another bird feeder pole about 15ft from this feeder, and it’s frequented by cardinals, finches, woodpeckers, and others. We’ve decided to remove it and save ourselves some headache and cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Hat

customer_reviews.title: One of the best window bird feeders
customer_reviews.text: I have had several window bird feeders. While this is smaller than my other ones, it is definitely better than the others as follows: (1) The ability to slide the window suction cups easily in and out of the bird feeder. (2) The extra suction cups that came with the birdfeeder (3) The open area in the birdfeeder makes it easier to see the birds – my other bird feeders are solid plastic and they get real dirty. (4) The sliding tray makes it every easy to refill the birdseed. This is also a great company that takes pride in meeting customer expectations.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Mulholland

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy feeder that the birds love!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great feeder - I love it so much that I ended up buying a second one for another window! I’ve left the first one I purchased for over a year now, and the suction cups are holding strong and the acrylic has stayed nice and clear (I have had similar feeders previously that have clouded up a bit after exposure). I live in Wisconsin, so these are able to withstand winter conditions well. Lots of visiting Cardinals, sparrows, gold finches, robins and more! My cat also enjoys watching this feeder!
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: A fascinating view of bird activity!
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t mind a messy outside windowsill or a window that needs cleaning a bit more often then these are for you. I happen to love these window feeders! They offer a fascinating view of bird interactions and viewings. I only use sunflower seeds as food because when any seeds fall on the soil below and germinate you’ll get beautiful sunflowers that’ll grow. Other seeds can produce grass or weeds. I’ve given these as gifts to elderly friends, family and grandchildren. Check with them first to see if they can handle the care of maintaining them which isn’t much but some people may find replenishing them with seed to be a pain!
customer_reviews.author: Madame D

customer_reviews.title: The birds like it but the next upgrade should be...
customer_reviews.text: Has anyone mentioned the circular rear hole is useless because the suction cups mount the feeder against a glass window?! I suppose if I forego the suction mount then maybe but why not just put little circular windows on the sides of feeder? Still, the birds seem to enjoy the free food. Although, it gets a bit cramped when 3 or more birds wanna eat. A couple of side windows and the birds wouldn't be elbowing each other in the face all day.
customer_reviews.author: Bshops2much!

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful opportunity to watch the birds feed...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Window Bird Feeder for work...my desk faces a large group of windows and having the window bird feeder allows me to feed the birds, as well as enjoy the beautiful cardinals and other wild birds. When people stop by my desk, they also enjoy seeing the birds feed. Having the Window Bird Feeder gives everyone a chance to “stop” and enjoy the beauty of God’s wonderful creatures! Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Up close and personal bird watching experience
customer_reviews.text: 2020-06-25 the tray seam fell apart. Tried to crazy glue it back together, but it just kept falling apart every few days. I since bought cheaper window feeders on Amazon and do not have this problem. Original review: Had to wait 3 days before any bird would check this feeder out. Birds are very alert and can see slightest movement in house and would fly away. After I added one way window mirror film to my window, I could stand next to the window and watch them up close and personal. So much fun. The little Finch is a big bully.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Birds or squirrels broke it
customer_reviews.text: I loved my little bird feeder but today I came back home and the sliding tray wasn’t there. I went outside and I’ve found the feeding tray cracked on the floor. I don’t know if a squirrel or a bird did this but in any case it wasn’t resistant like it’s advertised and I’m really sad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder, but squirrels loved it too
customer_reviews.text: Great feeder. Well made, attractive, and easy to use. Seed tray has plenty of weep holes in bottom to prevent seeds from becoming soggy and sprouting. Large suction cups hold it to window very well. Unfortunately, the local squirrels spent more time in it than the birds, driving them away, eating half the seeds and slinging the rest out onto the ground. We have no window where they couldn't get to it, so finally gave up and took it down. But that's not the fault of the feeder, which is itself excellent. If you don't have a squirrel problem, or can find a location to place this feeder where they can't reach it, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Lady

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Window Bird Feeder
customer_reviews.text: The bird feeder I received from Nature Gear is the first window feeder I’ve ever had that strongly adheres to the window. I love the sliding tray to fill the feeder. I was impressed by the quality of this product and look forward to seeing all the birds that visit our birdhouse. So far, no birds have tried it out, but that’s likely due to my noisy children watching it constantly and jabbering loudly every time a bird even looks like they might want to check it out. Still, it’s a great addition to my patio garden.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Nice little piece of nature in the city
customer_reviews.text: My husband thought I was nuts for buying this bird feeder, and quite honestly, I wasn't sure any birds would come to it. We live in the city and our wildlife consists of squirrels and skunks for the most part! But I persisted. This feeder was easy to put up and is very sturdy (sturdy enough to support a big, fat squirrel). But I've noticed a few little wrens feeding at it the last couple of days, and this morning, a bright red cardinal and his mate came to visit and enjoy a bit of feed. That just made my day! So, buy this and be patient! If you set it up, they will come!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: I like the little holes in the bottom that allow for ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, my cat loves it! We have this (larger than I expected) bird feeder on a window where my cat naps. She loves watching the birds stop by, and so far hasn't scared them off. I like the little holes in the bottom that allow for air flow. The window is under an overhang so it doesn't get wet in the rain, but the opening is quite large (for the birds) and so would likely get rain inside if not protected.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, strong feeder, fast shipping, great customer service. This feeder is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Nature Gear window-mount bird feeder. To be honest, I'd ordered it for a kitten to watch the birds, but we are the ones constantly watching the chickadees, finches, blue jays and cardinals and get so excited when we see the birds on the feeder and others waiting in a nearby bush. We followed the mounting instructions and, so far, it has stayed firmly in place even with our changing weather in New Hampshire. And much to our surprise, it didn't take but a day or two before the birds found it! I love it so much I'm hoping to order another with my Christmas money!
customer_reviews.author: Mitz888

customer_reviews.title: Adds so much joy to our life!
customer_reviews.text: My family loves animals, and has been supporting the local bird population for many years. This feeder is awesome, because we can see amazing birds up close. The best part is , all the activity attracts new and “rare” birds! a couple of months ago, we started seeing the run of the mill titmice , chicadees , woodpeckers ... but with the crescendo of spring , we have grosbeaks and orioles !!! Love this feeder ! I fill it with sunflower chips to attract the greatest range of birds. The yellow finches love it as well.
customer_reviews.author: LC_NYC

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For! Little Seed Spillage
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment and about a month ago I was asked to remove a bird feeder because all the seeds were spilling and making a mess onto other tenants property. I researched ALLOT during this time and found this excellent window bird feeder! Not only do I save on the seeds but there is barely any spillage! I am enjoying the heck out of this thing and couldn't say enough about it! Highly recommend especially if you live in an apartment complex. The instructions stated that it would take four to five weeks before the birds figure out where their food is. It took FOUR days for the birds to figure out. I love it!! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: WR

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful bird feeder. I have never seen birds so closely! I placed it on the 2nd story window right next to my bed. My cat loves sitting there all day to wait for her "friends." She adorably taps at the window when they land, but doesn't scare them away. I have enjoyed getting to view birds at a significantly closer distance than I have ever seen before. It's beautiful to see all of the detail, colors, and patterns in the birds when they are so close! Easy to refill and clean! I can do all of it through the window when I open it up and remove the screen!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC Feeder!
customer_reviews.text: Our birds love this feeder. Within minutes they had located it and got to work. It’s so fun to watch them through my window. Strongly adheres with the suction cups. In fact, you have to really work to get it off the window. Easy to clean as well. Only negative, and certainly not the fault of the feeder, is the Blackbirds (red-winged) and Starlings can fit into it too, and they monopolize it quite often. Some of our birds will just perch and rest for a while and/or stay out of the elements - and that’s pretty heartwarming to see. I’m definitely going to buy a few more!
customer_reviews.author: Eliana B.

customer_reviews.title: "Clearly" a great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautifully designed bird feeder. It's the dead of winter here where we live in The Great North Woods, so I'm not expecting a lot of activity until spring. But this bird feeder will let us see the birds from our living room, THROUGH the bird feeder, which is attached with three well-fitted suction cups to our glass sliding door to the patio facing some woods. Very happy with this purchase, compared to what's available at even greater prices at the big box stores. I plan on getting more as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Window Bird Feeder I have purchased. The first one was for my mother in Indiana who loves birds and has many different types of feeders. She absolutely raved about this feeder. Being able to watch the birds from inside her kitchen window all year long is fantastic. It is of great quality and the suction cups even hold the neighborhood squirrel who sometimes visits. Hysterical. Anyway, I then decided to purchase one for myself for use here in California and I LOVE it! A great product and I highly recommend this to everyone who loves watching birds.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Better than cable!
customer_reviews.text: I dont love it, but my grams does. This got her to watch less T.V. She can get right up to the window, lots of great feedback from her, and the tray is easy to dump, clean, and refill. Some of the Stellar jays that land in it barely fit, but the suction cups are strong enough that it does not matter!
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder for a wide variety of birds
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to mount, stays secure in significant wind and the shape of the top keeps most of the rain off of the food. It is also easy to clean and fill. The only potential option you might want to consider would be a 1 way window film which would be reflective and prevent the birds from watching us watch them. I do understand the level of engineering complexity that this would add to your well thought out shape and manufacturing process. We plan on ordering several more for family Christmas presents.
customer_reviews.author: MJW

customer_reviews.title: We love watching the birds from the family room.
customer_reviews.text: We have one to three bird nests every year so this year we decided to get bird feeders. This one is the favorite of the two. The seed stays in the tray and the clear view of the birds even entertains our dogs. The suction cups are STRONG. We had it on then read the tip to put a bit of oil on it first so we took it back off to put the oil. Big mistake we had to wipe all the oil off with alcohol wipes then remount it. We highly recommended this bird feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa V

customer_reviews.title: The coolest present .. just the nicest thing to buy!!  For anyone
customer_reviews.text: I am working on my laptop in the kitchen and they are all outside the window (the birds) munching away, chirping, fighting sometimes (lol). They LOVE it. So does my family. I even bought a second one to put on the other window as it was getting sooo popular. We even hung bagles with peanut butter covered in bird seeds nearby.. but nope.. they LOVE and I mean they LOVE these bird houses. Plus looks so cool looking at them from the kitchen. It took only a day for them to get comfortable to eat out of it. Not scared at all.
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids - and birds!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a window bird feeder as a gift for my daughter, who is 6 and loves nature. We installed it right on a window of her bedroom. Within a few days, we had cardinals, doves, sparrows and other neighborhood birds visiting. It's easy to fill, easy to maintain. And the kid and the birds love it. Kid has a running list of which birds visit her feeder, and still updates it even months later. Total parenting win.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Z

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift/ not so much
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling to think of a gift for three friends who have everything and are downsizing. Fortunately, they have grandchildren. BINGO! Perfect gift for all (and one for me). It is easy to fill, rain runs off, and I assume snow will not pile up, too. Visiting with the birds in the window makes doing dishes more fun. (Well, not fun exactly, but at least more entertaining.) And the cat likes to sit in the sink and watch the “Nature Channel.” Few months later. I have t change my review. Three out of four (haven't asked the last one yet) had the sides of the seed tray nap off, Crazy glue doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Henry.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for my bird watching 80+ year old mom
customer_reviews.text: This is the second window bird feeder I've purchased for my mom, but it seems to work better (suction power and removable feeding tray) than the previous one. I scattered some bird feed under the feeder like the directions suggested and the birds seemed to find the feeder much quicker this time (in a matter of a few days). My mom isn't super mobile anymore (she's in her 80's). She has a ton of bird feeders in the backyard, but this one brings the action much closer to her. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: DLG

customer_reviews.title: has staying ability
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this would stay up for long (I have a bad history with suction cups and gravity) but it's been a few weeks, through some truly horrid weather (wind, rain, snow, freezing cold) and it has stayed put. The feeder is big enough for birds like blue jays and cardinals, but that's probably the outer size limit. No squirrels so far, but it's possible they just haven't noticed it yet. UPDATE: Squirrels found it. Cats don't seem to mind though.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Birds and Humans like it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this feeder so my family could watch the birds up close while on quarantine. Took four days for the birds to find it (happened to be a rainy day so maybe they came for cover!). We had a hard time getting any pictures because the birds could see us coming so we got a motion sensor bird camera and set it up facing the window to get close up views and video. I had to move my feeder up once. The squirrel found it and was trying to climb on a bush to get to it. After I moved it up a couple inches we were good to go!
customer_reviews.author: LB in PA

customer_reviews.title: This Totally Sticks
customer_reviews.text: So glad this feeder clings hard to my window. I've seen my backyard birds up close and personal. They are getting braver about being so close to me. The cardinal and tufted titmouse are regular visitors, and occasionally the carolina wren drops by. Today, a squirrel tried to get into the feeder and was totally blocked. It's too small for him to leap into and just large enough for my larger backyard birds to hang out. This makes me very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Art Lover

customer_reviews.title: Good starter bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: Be patient! You'll need to have this up for a couple of weeks before the birds find it and are trusting enough to eat here. Cardinals were the first ones to use it at our house. Birds like it better if it's in a place where you can see them but not have a lot of physical activity going on around it, even through a window. They can see you! I liked this so much as a starter feeder, I just bought a larger and wider one, too, to add more space for the birds who come every day now.
customer_reviews.author: Ana S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: I could upload a million photos.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my mother for her birthday (or maybe Mother's Day, I can't remember) last year and I get a text with a photo from her about every two weeks exclaiming "have I told you how much I love my bird feeder!?" This thing has withstood rain storms, blizzards, and glaring heat over the past year and has never even thought about falling. If my mother could leave a review she would give it 10 stars and two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Gorko

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for the birds to find it.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great ... all we need is for the birds to find it. Turns out we were feeding more than birds and squirrels with our old feeder. We moved this one way up. Problem is no one has found it ( off second story window, above glass awning). We aren't surprised that so far it hadn't been found. Hopefully one day we will look out and see a bird eating. One is all it takes to spread the word. .
customer_reviews.author: Barb H

customer_reviews.title: Tray makes refilling feeder with food easy and convenient (I use a custom mixture that I ...
customer_reviews.text: Seamlessly replaced slightly smaller bird feeder with finches feeding within five minutes after I put it up. Tray makes refilling feeder with food easy and convenient (I use a custom mixture that I put together). Finches along with the occasional junco love eating in this feeder . Company sent an email with helpful info for installing, which is another plus. I use this feeder with an additional tray on the ground that attracts doves, sparrows and towhees. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Davis

customer_reviews.title: cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few weeks ago and we are really liking it. It's crystal clear, sturdy, and has stuck to the window without falling off despite wind and snow. It took a little while for the birds to find it, but they are enjoying it now. The cats are obsessed with it. We put some one-way window film up so the cats can watch the birds but the birds can't see the cats.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Bird Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Sorry this took so long, as I've been gone and didn't unpack I just wanted to say I'm impressed with your Window Bird Feeder. It is bigger then I thought. I had purchased it so I can use it on our motorhome window, cause we can't put anything in the ground to hang hone. I've been using it at my home right now and my cat just loves to see the birds up against the window, they don't even fear her any longer. It is easy to fill and the little cover keeps the seeds from getting wet and sticking together.
customer_reviews.author: FraZzledSue

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good size feeder and it suctions nice to any CLEAN window. The birds were highly skeptical at first. It took about 3 weeks to see my first bird visitor. It didn't help that I have a fat cat that loves to spook them away. I love this feeder. It's cute and hopefully more birds will begin to trust it. I may buy another feeder to add different types of bird food in there in hopes of attracting a variety of birds.
customer_reviews.author: D. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: sturdy bird feeder
customer_reviews.text: Feeder arrived unbroken unlike another offered from Amazon. Large tray is easily removable for disposing of sunflower hulls and general cleaning. Watching the birds interact is a relaxing experience, Product is well made and appears it will hold up in adverse weather conditions, I am a happy bird watcher. Thank you. Only continued attempts by squirrels to get in the feeder have dislodged the bar perch. Will need to superglue and it will be fine again.
customer_reviews.author: brenda c parsons

customer_reviews.title: Birds won't sit on it!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this up for two weeks now, and though the birds fly up to it, the clear construction and clear sitting post seems to really confuse them. They will not land on it. It's cute in theory, and the stock photos of birds happily eating from it made me really hope... but sadly it appears I now have an expensive piece of non-functional window art. My hubby is going to try painting the clear plastic perch a darker color, and maybe that will help.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer support.
customer_reviews.text: When we received our feeder there was an issue with the perch bar. It had come detached on one side. Probably damaged during shipping. I contacted support and they responded within minutes and offered a rush replacement, no questions asked. We put it on our window and had TONS of birds within days. Our cat won't leave the window now. It's like live TV for kitties. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zero Point

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: It took a few days for the birds to discover it, but I followed the included tips and placed some bird food on the ground nearby and now they are visiting often. I like that the circular cut-out in the back allows for very clear viewing of the birds. The suction cups are strong and I think this item is well made. I have a purple finch at my feeder as I am writing this!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: The cat loves his squirrel feeder
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to feed squirrels and entertain an easily bored cat. We had to keep inching it up the window to challenge the squirrels. It wasn’t long before they started using tools and working together. We now bow before our squirrel overlords. I apologize in advance for causing the squirrelpocalypse. The cat, however, is thoroughly entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this feeder, but it's too small. I should have paid closer attention to the dimensions. I just saw a cardinal and another bird in the feeder in the photo. It will fit the smaller chickadees and titmice, but too small for the cardinals. They fly up to it, but won't land. I bought it to replace a similar feeder that broke after falling in high winds that has open sides. I will keep this one, but have re-purchased the other one with the open sides that will fit at least two cardinals.
customer_reviews.author: Tina S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE**. I purchased this about a year ago and it still works great. I see all types of birds going to it. I even have one that constantly pecks on it until the draw falls. I taped one side to hold it and problem solved. You do have to clean it every so often but we absolutely Love this feeder. Cats and squirrels are not able to bother the birds.. Love this bird feeder. I have it on my kitchen window. The red cardinals are so beautiful to watch. I have had this for about 3 months now. It only took a couple days for birds to use it. Will definetly buy again and recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Love the Up Close Birdie Views!
customer_reviews.text: I attached my feeder to my home office window and kept the blinds partially closed at first. It took a couple days for the birds to find the feeder and then a couple more days for them to get totally used to my blinds all the way open. Now I get regular birdie visitors pretty much every day and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: K. Benton

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful in every way!
customer_reviews.text: Update: 5 months in and the birds LOVE IT! Finches, chickadees, and cardinals are my most frequent visitors but that may be largely due to my location and the type of seed I’m using. I LOVE having this in my window! Original: I love my Window Bird Feeder. So many house guests comment on how unique and clever it is. I am still waiting on birds to find and trust it. I spread seed around it and in my yard to attract them but of course with autumn creeping in I am more hopeful for summer. I love the sleek, clear design and the strength of the suction cups.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Cold weather protection and feeding station for the birds.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this window feeder to provide a winter wind shelter for birds in addition to its feeder function. It is a popular feeder with the birds but it is also serving well as a wind and weather shelter. The orioles are especially fond of it being a wind shelter, allowing them to warm up in this colder winter time and eat at the same time. The design is the only one I found that has totally full top to bottom sides which is why I selected this one. Have also had visits by house finches, gold finches, yellow rumped warblers, and bluebirds. Will be ordering another one of these.The birds have been fighting over it
customer_reviews.author: Catherine F.

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes to sit and watch the birds all day!
customer_reviews.text: I put this up in a second story window. It took a while for the birds to come around but this became a birdie hot spot as soon as summer rolled in. I like that the entire structure is clear and is very subtle if you're looking at the house from the street. It is really easy to clean and refill. The problem is that now my cat just wants to hang out upstairs and look at the birds and I kinda miss him.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary N. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I finally got this put on a window. It has been up almost 2 weeks and I got my first birds. Seems to be holding well. It is easy for me to get to for cleaning and refilling. Don't think the squirrels can get to this like they did my pole feeder. So pleased I am ordering two more. Another one for me and one for a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthya B

customer_reviews.title: Love this feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I am definitely giving this birdfeeder a five star review. It was so easy to put on my window, very sturdy and exactly what I wanted for my window to attract birds. And I am pretty sure my cat is going to LOVE IT! Update: Oh WOW!! It only took a week for the cardinals to find my feeder. It’s AMAZING watching them!! Love this feeder!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Feeder
customer_reviews.text: > We are most pleased with the clear Window Bird Feeder we purchased from you. We have it in the morning room of our home. The 3 suction cups add great stability to the feeder for the larger birds like blue jays and woodpeckers that have visited. The slide out tray is a nice feature for easy cleaning and quick refill. We have a regular visitor at the house who loved the feeder so we purchased one for her as a thank you gift for her kind support to our family. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect window feeder
customer_reviews.text: This was the first acrylic feeder we purchased for our sunroom and it has withstood a lot!! Today it welcomed 2 doves at once and the suction cups held strong. We did have a squirrel knock the tray out once. It fell 14 feet to the ground and survived with only one small crack, so I would call this feeder very sturdy. The birds all love it and it’s easy to clean with the removable tray. A wonderful addition to our acrylic bird feeder village (We have five different window feeders). It has brought us AND the birds many hours of pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Ehrlich

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love this feeder. We put it on the window nearest our other feeders and we’ve had all kinds of visitors. Cardinals, morning doves, sparrows and common grackles. Some get right inside the feeder and you have such an awesome view (from a distance because they’ll fly away if they see you). Easy to remove tray and clean. Strong suction.
customer_reviews.author: JalynRose

customer_reviews.title: Very nice feeder
customer_reviews.text: Nice feeder. Built well, no problems with it slipping from the window. I love that the tray comes out for easy cleaning & filling. The only thing I have negative to say about it is that the squirrels figured out how to get in it.. but they are smart and I'm not sure this can be helped. This is on our bedroom window, it's so cool to wake up and watch the birds from bed. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Berrios

customer_reviews.title: Bringing wildlife closer to enjoy
customer_reviews.text: Appreciated the helpful hints enclosed that increases suction power to the glass during freezing weather. Still at phase where the feeder is still on the ground, getting the birds acclimated to the new food source, but I am sure it will be great. Already weathered a good rain storm. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Michele G. Fuqua

customer_reviews.title: My third one
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these now because the birds love them so much. I really enjoy drinking my coffee and watching the birds on the window. The suction cups work really well. It can hold the doves and blue jays and even squirrels but they tend to go to the larger feeder on the window. I love the drawer that comes out so I can easy refill it without making a huge mess. Great product
customer_reviews.author: J. Albin

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: True to its word this product attracts birds and deters squirrels! I have had feeders in the past that are "squirrel resistant" but they weren't! With this one the squirrels look at it but haven't been able to get to it! Many birds have visited! Just this morning - at least 20 birds! Cardinals, Woodpecker, Tittmouse ect this. The suction cups are strong and even after a snow it was protected from the weather. It did take about 3 weeks for the birds to start coming. I would put out a trail of seed on the porch leading up to the feeder (trying to stop my dogs from eating it! ) and eventually they came!
customer_reviews.author: caryeersfan

customer_reviews.title: Birds love this, and so do I
customer_reviews.text: I love my window feeder. In the middle of this harsh, cold winter, the birds absolutely love eating out of my feeder. Some even sit on/in it, I think to warm up. The food tray is easy to clean and refill because it slides out. I love being able to watch the birds feeding while I am busy in the kitchen. I have it on the window right above my kitchen sink. Nothing like making washing dishes a fun experience!
customer_reviews.author: Cutis

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting for birds to discover the feeder
customer_reviews.text: I seems well built and was easy to install on my window. My only complaint is that I have had it up for almost 2 months and I have yet to see a bird eating out of the feeder. I have seen birds in my yard near the feeder picking at grass seeds on the ground, but no bird has landed on the feeder. I don’t know if it is because the plexiglass makes it hard to see where to land or what.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler W.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite window feeder after trying several :)
customer_reviews.text: I haven't owned this bird feeder very long so I can't speak to its sturdiness or ease of cleaning in the long run, but I can tell you it comes put together, sticks easily (and seemingly sturdily), and is larger and better looking than a similar style window feeder. We have two different brands of clear window feeders currently hanging in our window and this one is MUCH better quality all around. It's bigger, the material is thicker, the food tray is removable, and the back has a circle cut out so you can see inside much more easily. I have recommended this feeder to several friends!!
customer_reviews.author: Allena

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful bird feeder, I originally bought it so the cats could do some more bird watching. And apparently the local squirrels have seen the feeder and the suction cups are strong enough to support a full grown squirrel! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Love this feeder. I did not anticipate getting as much traffic ! The very next day after positioning the feeder on my kitchen window, I enjoyed numerous visits from what seemed like every bird in the immediate area. I am limited as to where I can place my feeder but so far the current location is great. It is not squirrel proof however due to my limited choices for placement. Otherwise it’s easy to clean and easy to fill. If anyone can suggest a squirrel deterrent I’d like to give it a try as long as they don’t harm the little guys.
customer_reviews.author: SQ49

customer_reviews.title: Well made product but no birds yet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this feeder, installed it on a window, and added the seed (Wagner's Deluxe Treat Blend  In the six weeks it's been up, I have not observed a single bird use the feeder and the seed appears not to have been touched. The window is facing our backyard that is frequented by birds. Maybe this is not a good time of year, but I'm in Southern Cal where there are birds out year round. I'm hoping as spring rolls around they'll start using the feeder. I'm giving it a mid-level rating since it appears to be a well-made product that installed easily, but it remains to be seen if the birds will actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven P

customer_reviews.title: Cat LOVES it! (so do the birds)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when we moved because my cat loves to sit and watch the birds, and when we moved to a place with no property, I was afraid she wouldn’t get to see any. I hung this on our glass slider, and it took a week or so for the birds to start using it, but they love it and so does my cat. She’ll sit for hours and watch, between this one and the one I have hanging off our deck. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy window feeder.  Installation really easy.
customer_reviews.text: The feeder is very sturdy and so far, it is sticking to the window well. It was easy to install. I just washed the window, wet the suction cups and pressed it to the glass. I can't wait to take pictures of birds through the view portal. Thank you very much for the extra suction cup. No birds have found the feeder yet. I am sure that the chipmunks will find it first.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Ayars

customer_reviews.title: cats love it lol
customer_reviews.text: It took a few months until the birds/squirrels found it, now the boys are loving it!!! The suction is still going strong (it's been about 6 months, though hot and cold temps). I saw pics of other people's feeders that they decorated which I feel like helps the birds to see it better. I just shoved some dried up vines or whatever on top of it
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Birds use this feeder.  Cats love the sights and sounds.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this feeder up all winter and now it’s spring. The cats are enthralled by the birds and gives hours of funentertainment. In all fairness, there are double feeders hanging that can’t be seen in the photo, so those help draw the birds. Very nice window feeder; I’d buy again.
customer_reviews.author: seaside77

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I got this mostly to entertain the cat, but also myself. it is made well and easy to use and clean. it did take a couple of weeks before the birds and squirrels discovered it on the window. Then, we installed the ac but they didn't seem to mind after that first day. I put a piece of wood to block the seeds from spilling inside it. We have gotten a variety of birds and several regulars including some cardinals and blue jays and of course the squirrels. The cat loves them! I am really pleased with this product and glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!  Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product and the birds love it. They noticed it within 24 hours of being in place. The blue jays, cardinals (male & female) and even the woodpeckers are eating out of this feeder. Great new additions to my list of visitors each morning. Occasionally they try to perch on the top so it would be nice to have it flat and maybe a bit larger to accommodate more than three at a time. After leaving this review, I’m sad to report the squirrels found a way to access the food. Very few bird feeders keep them away.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Campanaro

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but the squirrels will find a way!
customer_reviews.text: So far the squirrels have make it to the feeder. Since I last moved it to the upper window they have not pulled out the drawer and gotten all the feed. But considering some have made it to the roof of the feeder it's probably only a matter of time. Fortunately, my trusty dog is vigilant.
customer_reviews.author: Attikai

customer_reviews.title: looks good
customer_reviews.text: loos good, put it together, but have not used it yet. compared to the one i have it equals in quality.
customer_reviews.author: DeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: What I like about our Nature Gear Window Bird Feeder is that we can enjoy birds close up to us in our living room. Our cats also love the feeder, as they too can watch the birds. Of course, in tough Michigan winters having a bird feeder also really helps the birds survive!
customer_reviews.author: superdimitri

customer_reviews.title: This feeder is great! We got it to torment our indoor cat
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is great! We got it to torment our indoor cat, but we actually like it better than he does. It's not quite big enough for jays, crows, and other gluttons to access (although they like the leavings that drop to the ground). The small birds (goldfinches, sparrows, and others) were attracted to it within one day and the cat watching does not seem to bother them at all. A great feeder at a fun price!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it and so do my cats
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and used to go birdwatching and photographing birds, I can now look out my window and see Black-Capped Chickadees, Tufted Titmice, Cardinals, Juncos, Sparrows and it makes me so happy!. I really need more birdseed feeders and suet feeders because there are Blue Jays that are too heavy and large for the window feeder and Hairy, Downy and Yellow Bellied Woodpeckers that do not eat from these type of feeders. My cats really enjoy the show also!. And, the squirrels can't get in and eat all my sunflower seeds, HOORAY!! Thank you, Justine
customer_reviews.author: Justine Gorski

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeder for birdwatching
customer_reviews.text: This is my second window birdhouse and I like this one much better because the suction cups are attached to the feeder. The old ones were not and I was always dropping the cups. When it was knocked off the window they were lost for good. This feeder has been up for about a month. The finches and chickadees love it and it has withstood 50mph winds and aggressive squirrels so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lily's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I set mine up on a third floor window so the squirrels can't get to it. The suction cups work like a charm (just follow the instructions: clean and dry the cups and window first, and use a small drop of olive oil). I set mine up with a motion-activated camera (as seen in the photo) but if you want to do the same, keep in mind that cameras with passive infrared (PIR) sensors don't work well (or at all) through the window. Here you can see two mourning doves enjoying the feeder. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: it actually works!
customer_reviews.text: What I love most about the window bird feeder is it actually works! We continually have birds visiting it. The suction cups are strong and it had stayed secure on the window for the several months it's been up. The side walls and roof do a decent job of keeping out rain and snow, but on the stormier days when the seed does get rained or snowed on the small holes in the bottom of the tray have kept the seed from getting gross and moldy. My kids and I enjoy this window feeder very much. I do with it was a little larger to accommodate slightly bigger birds.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: Great window birdfeeder
customer_reviews.text: So happy to purchase the suction cup window bird feeder. A friend recommended your product and couldn’t be happier. My daughter loves watching and waiting for the blue jay to come by for his snack. So far it is only the blue jay that visits but we are hoping more will come the longer we have it.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Very cool!
customer_reviews.text: My Mom is very ill and can't get around much. She loves sitting by her bedroom window so I have been making a little bird sanctuary for her. This cute bird feeder has been the perfect addition. She has so many little birdies coming in and eating and she watches them talks to them. We keep the window open so she can hear them sing!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: First bird appeared in less than 5 minutes we love this product
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product after placing it on the window we had our first bird in less than five minutes. It is a pure joy to watch the birds come and get the food and we are so close to them from right inside the house I recommend this product anybody wants to watch birds
customer_reviews.author: North Carolina Muscle Machine

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this bird feeder for maybe a year now. The suction cups despite I’ve moved them around, switched windows, moved houses still hold up! Through a snowstorm and through southern summers baking in the sun this thing still looks brand new. It’s one of my favorite purchases. I love that birds and lots of squirrels come right up to my window. My cats love it too! If I could change one thing about it however, I wish there was some way so the squirrels can’t pull the drawer out. I ended up putting a little clear tape over the corner so they don’t dump it out.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome to watch birds and squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I got this so my parents could watch birds from their front window. However we got more entertainment watching the squirrels jump on it from the (2+feet) ledge and chase each other off. The house never fell down even with 2 squirrels on it! Great little entertainment house hah
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Love this birdfeeder outside of my kitchen window watching the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this birdfeeder outside of my kitchen window watching the birds come by. I wish though it was a little larger. It took a couple of weeks until the birds knew it was there but once they found it they come by all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: The birds love it!
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as advertised and my birds love it! I've had it for a few months now and I've found it very easy to clean and refill. It took some time for my birds to find it -- which I'm sure is true with any feeder in a new location -- but propping up a fallen branch near the feeder did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Harrison

product_meta.title: Nature Gear Window Bird Feeder - Refillable Sliding Tray - Weather Proof - Snow and Squirrel Resistant - Drains Rain Water - See Songbirds from Home!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,252 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
